sub_title: Technical Project Manager Wind Turbine Loads at SGRE
summary:
Scientist with business acumen. Specialized in wind turbine aerodynamics, loads and numerical software.

Nothing drives me more than helping teams and individuals aim for excellence. I believe transparent leadership transforms time and resource constraints into opportunities.

awards.title: EMS Young Scientist Travel Award
awards.description:
Awarded by the EMS for an outstanding poster presented at the 8th Earth Observation Summer School on Earth System Monitoring and Modelling held from 1 to 12 August 2016 at the ESA/ESRIN facilities in Frascati, Italy.

Title of Contribution: Gazing at the clouds to design better wind turbine aerofoils.

awards.title: Letter of appreciation
awards.description: Letter of appreciation for contribution to development of online (blended) learning course in Rotor Aerodynamics.

awards.title: Olimpíadas Nacionais de Física (Escalão B, 3º classificado)

projects.title: Building a 2kW Wind Turbine in Mopti, Mali
projects.description: The construction of a 2kW Wind Turbine by local craftsmen in Mopti was the culmination of an intense capacity building program which I planned and executed. My role in building this machine was that of an advisor as all the work was performed by the craftsmen we supported: the proof that we succeeded as capacity builders.

profile_positions.description:
Part of loads and control, focused on offshore wind turbines. My scope adapts to needs. Currently: 
1. Drive validation of tools and processes for the prediction of wind turbine installation loads. Includes management of suppliers and selection of sensors for field validation.
2. Co-lead efforts towards architectural overhaul of in-house aero-elastic simulation code.
3. Act as technical expert for root cause analysis of load and power deviations during new product development and certification.
4. Ramp up software teams that work on load pre and post-processing tools across diverse geographies. Includes plans for staff development and stakeholder management over large interfaces.
profile_positions.title: Technical Project Manager, Wind Turbine Loads and Control

profile_positions.description: Part of aerodynamics team. Co-lead R&D projects for improving speed and accuracy of wind turbine simulation tools and engaged in several RCA studies. Delivered beyond expectations by fostering team spirit and open communication with system dynamics, loads, performance and platform teams. Major successes developing new methods recognized by "Vice-President's Quality Excellence award".
profile_positions.title: Lead Wind Turbine Aerodynamics Engineer

profile_positions.description: Modernized numerical codes (Fortran/C++) for the design and simulation of Claus sulphur-recovery processes (Comprimo). Used CFD to improve reliability of fluidized bed reactors.
profile_positions.title: System Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Used aerodynamics to reduce the cost of wind energy.  Co-authored 14 peer-reviewed contributions about rotor and airfoil aerodynamics, collected in a thesis titled "Aerodynamic Perspectives on Wind Energy Efficiency". 

Main techniques: analytical modelling, multidisciplinary design optimization (MDO), computational fluid dynamics (CFD), particle image velocimetry (PIV), machine-learning.

Awards: "Young Scientist Travel Award" of the European Meteorological Society (EMS)
profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
Transposed rotor aerodynamics course to blended learning, delivered practical and theory lectures,  coordinated redesign of content program with contributions from NREL and DTU/EWEM. 

Awards: "Letter of Appreciation" from the vice-president for Education and operations.
profile_positions.title: Researcher/Lecturer

profile_positions.description: Aerodynamic consulting for clients in the wind energy (conventional/airborne), UAV and automotive industries. Interacted with startups and hired fellow PhD colleagues.
profile_positions.title: Aerodynamicist, Owner

profile_positions.description: Part of a large (ACP-EU Energy Facility) project (JATROREF) for promotting community scale extraction of Jatropha oil to support rural energy access in southern Benin.
profile_positions.title: Charge de mission,  Projet Jatroref - International Development Cooperation

profile_positions.description: Lead field execution of decentralised cooperation projects related to energy access, rural entrepreneurship and vocational education. Liaising with public bodies and proposal writing. Participation in coordination instances (UNOCHA, UNICEF, FONGIM).
profile_positions.title: Project Manager - International Development Cooperation

profile_positions.description: Contributed to projects for major clients in the energy (GE), aerospace (ADSE), automotive and maritime (VPLP) Industries. Developed a multi-objective airfoil optimiser and a probabilistic wind turbine blade design methodology.
profile_positions.title: Aerodynamic Design Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description: Advisor on production of small scale wind turbines in Madagascar with appropriate technology approach.

Part of the brainstorm and initial steps that established Lisbon's largest student radio in the late 2000s. Organised construction of first studio and commissioned second studio. Tried to raise funds many times and occasionally succeeded (EU-Youth, PMQE, corporate).

volunteer_experiences.role: European Voluntary Service (EVS, EU Youth Programme)
volunteer_experiences.description:
European Voluntary Service (EVS) under EU-Youth program. Coaching and organisation of cultural activities for the youth of Waidhofen an der Ybbs (Austria). Support of migrant and refugee youngsters. Curated a festival with video-linked concert in cooperation with Radio Zero (Lisbon). Built Bagger's website (still working after 11 years!).

Kapuzinergasse 3, A-3340, Waidhofen an der Ybbs, Österreich

Casa 6 is a non-profit organization working with migrant and economically distressed communities near Lisbon (Mira-Sintra). I established a basic IT-skills course for adults and supported teenagers with homework.
